intro: Scleranthus friedrichsthalii, commonly known as the Friedrichsthal's thornweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Scleranthus friedrichsthalii is part of the genus Scleranthus, which includes several species with similar morphological traits.
